docs.abstract: Russian officials are investigating Apple’s moves to remove parental control apps from its App Store shortly after it released a competing service.
docs.snippet: Russian officials are investigating Apple’s moves to remove parental control apps from its App Store shortly after it released a competing service.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Russian officials opened an antitrust investigation into Apple for restricting and removing parental control apps from its App Store shortly after the company released its own competing service, the latest sign of the growing scrutiny of Silicon Valley’s power.

headline.main: Russia Opens Antitrust Inquiry Into App Restriction at Apple
headline.print_headline: Russia Opens Inquiry Into Apple’s Practices

docs.abstract: Political chaos and confrontation with the European Union over spending rules have reinforced what a finance professor calls the country’s “serial stagnation.”
docs.snippet: Political chaos and confrontation with the European Union over spending rules have reinforced what a finance professor calls the country’s “serial stagnation.”
docs.lead_paragraph: NAPLES, Italy — Whatever hopes there were that a radically unconventional government might jolt Italy out of its economic torpor have mostly given way to bitter resignation that, in this country, nothing ever seems to change.

headline.main: Italy’s Biggest Economic Problem? It’s Still Italy

docs.abstract: A growing number of companies are marketing them to parents who are desperate to protect their children from gunmen.
docs.snippet: A growing number of companies are marketing them to parents who are desperate to protect their children from gunmen.
docs.lead_paragraph: Before his freshman year at the University of Connecticut, J.T. Lewis received an unusual gift from his mother: a bulletproof backpack.

headline.main: Bulletproof Backpacks in Demand for Back-to-School Shopping

docs.abstract: The massacre raised new questions about why the retailer has been the source of so many calls to police departments, and whether it has done enough to deter crime.
docs.snippet: The massacre raised new questions about why the retailer has been the source of so many calls to police departments, and whether it has done enough to deter crime.
docs.lead_paragraph: A 21-year-old man was charged with murder last week after shooting another man in the parking lot of a Walmart in Auburn, Me. At the retailer’s store in North Bergen, N.J., a woman squirted pepper spray at people around the customer service desk in February, temporarily blinding some employees and customers. She then retreated into a back room, wielding a knife and shouting obscenities.

headline.main: Walmart Shooting in El Paso Renews Attention on Crime Frequency at Its Stores
headline.print_headline: Shooting Renews Scrutiny of Walmart Stores for Frequency of Crime

docs.abstract: Yields on United States government bonds fell, indicating lower expectations for growth and extending a drop that began as the trade war intensified.
docs.snippet: Yields on United States government bonds fell, indicating lower expectations for growth and extending a drop that began as the trade war intensified.
docs.lead_paragraph: Trade-war worries hammered financial markets again on Wednesday as data from Germany and China showed trouble for manufacturing-reliant economies, while the bond market renewed fears of an American recession.

headline.main: Stock Markets, Jolted by Economic Worry, Suffer 2nd Worst Drop of 2019
headline.print_headline: Warning Signals Flash, and Shares Plunge

docs.abstract: Language like “invasion” and the “replacement” of Americans has increasingly become a regular part of Fox News broadcasts, Rush Limbaugh shows and other prominent conservative media.
docs.snippet: Language like “invasion” and the “replacement” of Americans has increasingly become a regular part of Fox News broadcasts, Rush Limbaugh shows and other prominent conservative media.
docs.lead_paragraph: Language like “invasion” and the “replacement” of Americans has increasingly become a regular part of Fox News broadcasts, Rush Limbaugh shows and other prominent conservative media.

headline.main: How the El Paso Killer Echoed the Incendiary Words of Conservative Media Stars
headline.print_headline: How the El Paso Gunman Echoed The Words of Right-Wing Pundits

byline.original: By Jeremy W. Peters, Michael M. Grynbaum, Keith Collins, Rich Harris and Rumsey Taylor

docs.abstract: Shares on Wall Street fell sharply after reports showed a slowdown in China and a contraction in Germany, partly reflecting the U.S. trade war’s impact.
docs.snippet: Shares on Wall Street fell sharply after reports showed a slowdown in China and a contraction in Germany, partly reflecting the U.S. trade war’s impact.
docs.lead_paragraph: The global economy is under increasing stress as growth cools and trade tensions take a mounting toll. On Wednesday, the tremors were felt worldwide.

headline.main: Markets Are Shaken by New Signs of Global Economic Trouble
headline.print_headline: Markets Shudder as Signs  Point to Global Slowdown

byline.original: By Nelson D. Schwartz, Jack Ewing, Matt Phillips and Stephen Grocer

docs.abstract: Parents should monitor spending and explain how to pay the bill on time. A financial planner says teenagers should get a card. “We live in a credit-driven society.”
docs.snippet: Parents should monitor spending and explain how to pay the bill on time. A financial planner says teenagers should get a card. “We live in a credit-driven society.”
docs.lead_paragraph: Giving a teenager a credit card may seem a risky proposition. But finance experts say it can be a helpful educational step, with proper limits.

headline.main: Give Your Teenager a Credit Card? Some Financial Experts Say Yes
headline.print_headline: Maybe Too Young for a Car, but Old Enough for a Card

docs.abstract: Stocks were heading higher before the president wrote on Twitter that he would raise tariffs on $300 billion of Chinese imports.
docs.snippet: Stocks were heading higher before the president wrote on Twitter that he would raise tariffs on $300 billion of Chinese imports.
docs.lead_paragraph: A fresh tariff threat from President Trump sank stocks on Thursday, pushing the S&P 500 to its fourth consecutive daily decline and reinvigorating investor worries about the outlook for the global economy.

headline.main: Stocks Sink After a New Tariff Threat From Trump

docs.abstract: There’s new evidence that viewing habits can affect your thinking, political preferences, even cognitive ability.
docs.snippet: There’s new evidence that viewing habits can affect your thinking, political preferences, even cognitive ability.
docs.lead_paragraph: Other than sleeping and working, Americans are more likely to watch television than engage in any other activity.

headline.main: You Are What You Watch? The Social Effects of TV
headline.print_headline: You Are What You Watch? The Social Effects of TV
